data.name: The Odd Neon Void
data.detailed_description:
The Odd Neon Void is an experimental Adventure/RPG game inspired by Atari 2600 and Commodore64 aesthetics. TONV brings elements from various videogame genres, such as action, adventure and RPG and combines with an original system of stats.
In TONV, you become Jack, a character stuck in a strange and unfamiliar reality: the neon void, which consists in three distinct dungeons. The neon void is filled with creatures called bugs, which you may want to kill in order to both survive and increase your stats. Throughout the gameplay, you may discover a series of notes that can also increase your stats and clarify the plot.
At the ending, depending on the choices you've made, you might expect different endings.
*WARNING: This video game may potentially trigger seizures for people with photosensitive epilepsy. Player discretion is advised.

data.short_description: The Odd Neon Void is an experimental Adventure/RPG game where you become Jack, a man stuck in a strange and unfamiliar place called the neon void. Don't be too sad.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 8
  • Processor: 1.4 GHz
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated Graphics
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

content_descriptors.notes: The Odd Neon Void contain scenes that might suggest self-harm acts and violence. If you think this kind of mature content can be potential bad for your mental or physical health, do not play this game. This video game may potentially trigger seizures for people with photosensitive epilepsy. Player discretion is advised.
